hackathon-description-text: BostonHacks is Boston University's premier overnight hackathon, attracting over 300 students during its inaugural event. Come join us for BostonHacks Spring 2017 for a weekend of free food, free swag, fun mini-events, and of course, lots and lots of hacking!
hackathon-eligibility:
Anyone over the age of 18 who is currently enrolled in a college or university is welcome to attend! Prior programming experience is not required to participate.
To be eligible for prizes, a team can be at most four people.
hackathon-requirements: Make your project, submit it to Devpost, and demo it during the project expo! You'll have to do all three to be eligible for projects.
hackathon-rules:
To be eligible for prizes, a team can be at most four people.
The project must also be submitted to Devpost before the submission deadline.
Projects cannot be started/worked on prior to the hackathon, i.e. all work for projects must occur during BostonHacks.
We follow the 
.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Citi Bank is offerring $1500 to the team that creates the hack that most benefits freelancers in the rising gig economy.
BU Spark! is offering $250 to the team that creates the best application for one of the three following categories:

Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best use of Button, found at
